issue.title: [CF 1247] Buff check for Obliteration share same query
issue.body:
Hi,i´m playing a dk and noticed that the spell obliteration from the 100 talent share the same check query with the buff obliteration from the t18-set.
It should check the buff from the level 100 spell obliteration and not from the t-18 set. I´m using the id  207256 in the buff to check query.
I also did some screenshots from it. "Auslöschung" is german for obliteration.
Is it possible to fix this?

My string:

^1^T^SType^Sconditionicon ^SConditions^T ^N1^T ^SType^SBUFFSTACKS ^SChecked^B ^SName^SAuslöschung ^t^Sn^N1 ^t^SCustomTex^S207256 ^SEnabled^B ^t^N80301^S~`~| ^Sicon^^

What version of TellMeWhen are you using? ("The latest" is not a version)
8.0.3


> Posted by CurseForge user Mindfork | Imported from CurseForge issue #1247 | Raw

> Posted by CurseForge user Mindfork

You're only using 207256 as the custom texture. That's not going to to anything aside from affecting the appearance of the icon. You need to use 207256 as the buff to track in the condition in order to get it to detect the correct buff.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

So,for clearer understanding:

Does that mean that if you use a name as tracker,it is checking for the names of it but if you want to have it exact you need the id of it. Is my interpretation correct?

Btw,its working correctly with the id.

Thx so far

Edited Jul 24, 2016

> Posted by CurseForge user Mindfork
